node.title: Audio of suspect in woman's 1993 college dorm murder played at trial
node.description: Sophie Sergie was found with multiple injuries and a gunshot wound in a bathroom of a dorm at the University of Alaska at Fairbanks.

node.title: Carl Bernstein on the political climate in Washington - "The Takeout"
node.description: On "The Takeout" podcast this week, Carl Bernstein talks about his new memoir with host Major Garrett.

node.title: Black man shot to death by Minneapolis police wasn't named in warrants
node.description: Authorities identified him as Amir Locke, 22. Body cam video shows him wrapped in a blanket on a couch, then displaying a handgun when officers entered.

node.title: What’s in a name? For Taiwan, a lot.
node.description: Officials from the self-governing island worry that China might use the Games as a linguistic opportunity to assert its claim over Taiwan.

node.title: Many West Coast slips cleared, but work to continue over long weekend
node.description: NZTA says road crews have cleared many of the slips, but there are still slips and debris along State Highway 6 heading into Westport, around the Fox Hills, and elsewhere on the West Coast. Audio

node.title: Fix on the way for Masterton's slumping bridge
node.description: Masterton residents have expressed concern about whether it is safe to use the southbound Colombo Bridge in its current condition.

node.title: Fans say the magic gift of Disney's Encanto is feeling seen
node.description: Fans of the Disney movie Encanto share their experiences of the moment the movie made them "feel seen".

node.title: Meet some of the Australian teens on the hunt for Olympic gold
node.description: Four teenagers are making their Winter Olympic debut with the Australian team this month — and they plan to make every moment count while competing at Beijing 2022.

node.title: Are our CBDs dying, or is the role they play just evolving?
node.description: COVID has nearly killed the city centre. Now experts are pondering what the future of the CBD will be in post-pandemic Australia.

node.title: NT 'thwarted again' as court rules public housing tenants entitled to 'reasonable comfort'
node.description: Residents in the remote community of Santa Teresa celebrate a landmark win in a drawn-out legal fight that will set "a new legal standard" for all tenants in the NT.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 209 new community cases in NZ today
node.description: There are 209 new cases of Covid-19 in the community today, with another 14 cases reported at the border.

node.title: Covid-19: Novavax vaccine gains provisional Medsafe approval
node.description: Nuvaxovid is the fourth Covid-19 vaccine to gain provisional approval from New Zealand's medicines regulator.

node.title: Wool industry fears mass exodus as Kiwi shearers pack their bags
node.description: Kiwi shearers in Western Australia are already planning to return to New Zealand after the country announced its border reopening plan.

node.title: MIQ workers fear wage cuts as facilities set to return to hotels
node.description: Workers who have been running managed isolation facilities for two years fear their wages could be about to drop, if their hotels return to regular operations.

node.title: Your Friday Briefing
node.description: ISIS leader dead in U.S. raid.

node.title: Dairy prices on the rise amid supply contraints
node.description: Global dairy prices have hit their highest level in eight years raising the prospect of further rises in dairy farmer payouts.

node.title: Iwi to place rāhui on Hauraki Gulf to help scallop beds recover
node.description: Ngāti Manuhiri Settlement Trust chief executive Nicola MacDonald says the rāhui will be put in place on Waitangi Day.

node.title: Calls for Fiji govt to give updates on PM's health
node.description: A pro-democracy activist in Fiji is calling for the government to provide regular updates about the health of Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama to cancel out rumours and fake news.

node.title: The famed Tongan flag bearer won’t attend the Games.
node.description: Pita Taufatofua, a three-time Olympian, is focused instead on the disaster response to a powerful tsunami that struck his island nation.

node.title: Zuckerberg loses $29b in a day as Meta shares crash
node.description: Mark Zuckerberg has lost $29 billion in net worth in a day as Meta Platforms Inc's stock marked a record one-day plunge after a disappointing earnings forecast.

node.title: NZ Covid-19 Omicron strategy 'too cautious' - epidemiologist
node.description: An epidemiologist in Australia is warning New Zealand's Omicron approach is overcautious and may mean the variant is active in the community for longer. Audio

node.title: Golf, Saudi Arabia and 'obnoxious greed': How the game's greatest issue is coming to a head
node.description: Saudi Arabia's bid to become a major player in golf is gathering speed, and recent comments from players such as Phil Mickelson have only increased speculation. It's been a big week for the game's biggest issue.

node.title: Soldier with 'distinctive' weapon shot dead Afghan man, Ben Roberts-Smith trial told
node.description: An active SAS member tells a Sydney court he saw "a black object similar to a human" being thrown to the ground and a soldier firing at it with a Minimi F89 Para gun, seen later being carried by Ben Roberts-Smith.

node.title: Rita Ora signs record deal that lets her own her masters
node.description: Rita Ora has signed a global recording deal with BMG that gives her ownership of all future master recordings.

node.title: Investors can expect some healthy returns despite 'muted outlook'
node.description: Investment funds are expected to deliver good returns over the coming year, despite rising inflation and interest rates.

node.title: Buller District mayor announces Westport evacuations as more heavy rainfall expected to hit
node.description: Civil Defence has ordered a partial compulsory evacuation of Westport after days of rain and more heavy falls expected tonight.

node.title: Gregory McMichael withdraws plea after judge blocks agreement
node.description: The trial for Gregory McMichael, who has already been convicted of killing the 25-year-old Black man in 2020, is scheduled to begin on Monday.

node.title: Mount Everest's highest glacier is losing decades' worth of ice every year, scientists warn
node.description: Climbing the highest mountain in the world could become more dangerous due to the lack of ice.

node.title: Covid-19: Community isolation scheme needs to be overhauled - study
node.description: New Zealand needs to overhaul its Covid-19 community isolation scheme and better fund GPs and primary healthcare workers on the front line, a new paper says.

node.title: RNC to consider resolution to censure Cheney and Kinzinger
node.description: The RNC's resolutions committee unanimously passed the resolution on Thursday afternoon, and the full RNC will vote on Friday.
